title: Drawing, "Sheet from a Sketchbook: Minerva Orders Ulysses to Make Peace with the Suitors of Penelope (Minerva induce Ulisse alla pace con i Proci)", before 1805
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, traces of graphite on cream laid paper
inscribed:
Below image in pen and brown ink over graphite: Minerva ordina a' Vlisse la pace onc li Proci. 
Verso: a rectangle outlined in graphite.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: The battle takes place at the edge of the sea, with many men involved.  The flying Minerva touches the sword of Ulysses and points at Jupiter seated upon clouds in the left upper corner.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Sheet from a Sketchbook: Minerva Orders Ulysses to Make Peace with the Suitors of Penelope (Minerva induce Ulisse alla pace con i Proci)", before 1805.
before 1805. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, traces of graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3343.
